name: Sam Freed
tagline: Computer Engineering Student at Cal Poly SLO
body:
### About
I'm currently a 3rd year undergraduate student at California Polytechnic State University San Luis Obispo, majoring in Computer Engineering and minoring in Math. I love to program and solve problems. My areas of interest are Computer Graphics and Embedded Systems. I plan on pursuing a master's degree in computer science after I complete my undergraduate work.

### Projects
Unfortunately, all of my class projects must be private in order to prevent other students from plagiarizing. Most other personal projects are me playing around with something that doesn't warrant creating a new repository. However, I'm considering porting the raytracing project I'm currently working on in CPE 473: Advanced Rendering to Rust, a language I've dabbled with a bit but would like to actually make something substantial with. Anyways, here is a list of projects I've worked on:

* Implemented a simple microcontroller on a Nexys 3 FPGA using VHDL. The microcontroller was then programmed using assembly to create a simple 1-player pong game. This game also utilized a VGA module for display output and a UART module for serial communication (both modules were also implemented on the FPGA using VHDL).
* Implemented data structures and algorithms such as stacks, queues, heaps, binary search trees, AVL trees, sorting algorithms, graph algorithms, dynamic programming, and greedy algorithms.
* Decompressor in C using the LZW algorithm.
* Linear simulator in C.
* Automated building and testing system in C.
* MIPS Assembler and Simulator (written in Java).
* Created a scene using C++ and OpenGL. The program used deferred shading, bloom, and SSAO. See [here](http://users.csc.calpoly.edu/~zwood/teaching/csc471/finalW16_3/stfreed/index.html) for a complete write-up of the project.
* A report on using numerical integration techniques to create a parameterization of a curve which moves at constant speed over time. View the report [here](https://www.overleaf.com/read/fywgrqsktwzv).

Current projects (Spring Quarter 2016):

* Advanced raytracer (goal is to support advanced lighting such as global lighting, reflection, refraction, and shadows. If time permits, volumetric lighting will be added).
* Exploring the TI MSP430G2553 microcontroller. Final project will involve interfacing the microcontroller with various sensors and displays to create a useful, real-world product.

### Course Overview
Software: Data Structures & Algorithms, Systems Programming, Computer Architecture, Computer Graphics, Advanced Rendering

Hardware: Circuit Analysis, Digital & Computer Design, Digital Electronics, Embedded Systems

Math: Calculus, Linear Algebra, Numerical Analysis, Numerical Optimization

### Resume
A version of my resume is available [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DKrZVp89BuflP0Quqkug5riMBp2vRjINZmHbATHvE3o/edit?usp=sharing), with personal information removed. Last updated 4/4/2016.
